intro: Leptorumohra, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Leptorumohra is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
